column4: can someone explain why i do not have the option of installing nvidia drivers in hardware drivers manager?
ive notice that on some nvidia cards. the tool doseent recoginze them as being nvidia cards.
from dmesg log it suggests it attaches as /dev/sde but i can't fdisk this
fdisk /dev/sde says "Unable to open /dev/sde" ( as per pastebin)
you want data from it? or just tring to get it wirking?
get data - well i want to check what it is before i wipe, just incase i need it
try the text option perhaps.. or theres doxzens of live cds out there that can do it. like 'tiny core linux'
is that text mode installation or something else?
theres live cd's that can do console only.
depends on yoru needs.  'text' mode in ubuntu live cd might work.
how do i enable that? i know there's a text mode installer on the alt cd, i'm unfamilar with text mode - is this just a grub setting you pass in?
